titleStmt.title: James Y. Kelly et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10943

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Scott County Ky -- Oct 9th 1861
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin --

The undersigned citizens of Scott County -- recommend to your clemency Sanford Chowning -- who at the November term of the Scott Circuit court was found guilty of keeping a tipling house and fined Sixty Dollars --

The circumstances of the case was not agravtating -- and grew out of an ignorance of the hability of Chowning -- ^Chowning^ who is a poor man -- and will be greatly distressed at this time by the enforcing of the judgement --

James Y Kelly
Bat T Thompson
S R Thomson
Ed Lucas
Sam W Thompson
G W Offutt
Geo E Prewitt
^Direct anwer to^ T. I. Burns
D W Gatwood
J C Applegate
C D Smith
TI. T Pratt
A Hawkins
W R Webb
